news.title: Google Explains Why Sites With Some SEO Bad Practices Rank Well
news.description: Google uses multiple algorithms to rank sites, such that search engine rankings are essentially a balancing act considering various factors designed to focus on the overall value of a website.

news.title: How Do I Change my Google My Business Logo?
news.description: Changing your logo on your Google My Business profile may be just as simple as updating your cover photo on the Google My Business website.

news.title: Google URL Inspection Tool Now Displays Multiple Referring Pages
news.description: A recent update to Google Search Console allows users to view multiple sources used by Google to discover your URL, as opposed to a single source.

news.title: Google's Thoughts On Selling Domains Based On SEO Value
news.description: According to certain Google employees, buying used domains based on their SEO footprint is similar to buying a car based on a topped-off gas tank.

news.title: Google Posts No Longer Expire After Seven Days
news.description: Google Posts, which allow businesses to communicate with customers through their Google My Business listings, are appearing in the Knowledge Panel beyond the previous expiration window.

news.title: Schema.org vs Google Structured Data Rich Results
news.description: If you use structured data that is published on Schema.org and also listed on the Google developer site, you can benefit by showing up with richer search results in Google Search.
